bestBHT.bht: The Sadducees, known for their denial of the resurrection, sought to disprove it by posing a question about marriage after death. This was a common conundrum they used to mock the Pharisees. However, Jesus exposed their flawed reasoning and unbelief, leaving them defeated in their attempt to challenge Him.

Archibald T. Robertson: There is no resurrection (αναστασιν μη εινα). Accusative and infinitive with negative μη in indirect assertion.
The Sadducees rally after the complete discomfiture of the Pharisees and Herodians.
They had a stock conundrum with which they had often gotten a laugh on the Pharisees.
John Gill: which deny that there is any resurrection; that is, of the dead; that there ever was any instance of it, or ever will be: this was the distinguishing tenet of that sect"
the following question, after they had put a case to him.

bhtAttempts.bht: The Sadducees, known for their denial of the resurrection, posed a question to Jesus in an attempt to disprove it. This was a common conundrum that they enjoyed presenting to the Pharisees. However, their question was met with complete discomfiture as Jesus dismantled their argument. (Luke 20:27)

The Sadducees, who denied the resurrection, tried to challenge Jesus with a question about marriage after death. This was a familiar tactic they used against the Pharisees. However, Jesus skillfully and completely refuted their argument, leaving them utterly defeated.

The Sadducees, known for their denial of the resurrection, sought to disprove it by posing a question about marriage after death. This was a common conundrum they used to mock the Pharisees. However, Jesus exposed their flawed reasoning and unbelief, leaving them defeated in their attempt to challenge Him.

The Sadducees, who denied the resurrection, encountered Jesus with their customary question regarding marriage after death. However, Jesus effortlessly exposed the flawed reasoning behind their inquiry, leaving them defeated and unable to challenge Him any further.

The Sadducees, who were known for their denial of the resurrection, attempted to challenge Jesus with a question about marriage after death. This was a common conundrum they used to mock the Pharisees. However, Jesus skillfully dismantled their argument and left them completely defeated, unable to present any further challenges to Him.
